Package com.kicas.rp.util

Class Encoder

java.lang.Object
com.kicas.rp.util.Encoder
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, Flushable, AutoCloseable
public class Encoder extends Object implements Flushable, Closeable
This class writes various data types to an output stream in the form of bytes.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Encoder(OutputStream out)
    Constructs a new encoder with a specified output stream, and defaults to not compressing length measurements.

    • writeUintCompressed

      public void writeUintCompressed(int i) throws IOException
      Writes an unsigned integer to the output stream after it is compressed. This algorithm precedes the bytes representing the integer with various markers dictating how long the number is, allowing the integer to take up less space if its numerical value is relatively small. The given integer will be mapped like so:
      • i < 64 -> 1 byte
      • i < 16,384 -> 2 bytes
      • i < 4,194,304 -> 3 bytes
      • else -> 4 bytes
      Parameters:
      i - the unsigned integer to write.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • writeIntCompressed

      public void writeIntCompressed(int i) throws IOException
      Writes a signed integer to the output stream after it is compressed. This algorithm precedes the bytes representing the integer with various markers dictating how long the number is, allowing the integer to take up less space if its numerical value is relatively small. The given integer will be mapped like so:
      • |i| < 32 -> 1 byte
      • |i| < 8,192 -> 2 bytes
      • |i| < 2,097,152 -> 3 bytes
      • else -> 4 bytes
      Parameters:
      i - the unsigned integer to write.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • writeFloat

      public void writeFloat(float f) throws IOException
      Writes a float to the output stream according to the IEEE 754 floating-point "single format" bit layout, preserving Not-a-Number (NaN) values.
      Parameters:
      f - the float.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • writeFloatArray

      public void writeFloatArray(float[] a) throws IOException
      Writes an array of floats to the output stream according to the IEEE 754 floating-point "single format" bit layout, preserving Not-a-Number (NaN) values.
      Parameters:
      a - the array.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      public void writeDouble(double d) throws IOException
